articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A vessel that was approaching Freedom Flotilla Coalition's Gaza-bound charity ship the Madleen has left, the coalition said early on Monday, after an alarm was sounded on the ship warning of a possible interception.
articles.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition says vessel approaching Gaza-bound ship left

articles.author: Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine carried out an exchange of prisoners of war on Monday involving POWs under the age of 25 and others who had been severely wounded, the start of what could become the biggest swap of the war so far.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange group of younger and wounded prisoners of war

articles.author: Kate Holton, Dan Burns
articles.description: Top U.S. and Chinese officials were due to meet in London on Monday for talks aimed at defusing the high-stakes trade dispute that has widened in recent weeks beyond tit-for-tat tariffs to export controls over goods critical to global supply chains.
articles.title: US and Chinese officials to meet in London for pivotal trade talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police declared all of downtown Los Angeles to be an unlawful assembly area and ordered protesters to go home after a third day of violence hit demonstrations against President Donald Trump's immigration policy.
articles.title: Los Angeles police order immigration protesters in downtown to go home

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit Ukraine with its largest drone attack since the start of the war, the Ukrainian air force said.
articles.title: Russia launches biggest drone attack on Ukraine, targets military airfield, Kyiv says

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: One of Sean Diddy Combs' former girlfriends testified on Monday in the hip-hop mogul's sex trafficking trial that she told him in text messages that she felt mistreated in their relationship and asked to stop taking part in sexual performances with other men.
articles.title: 'I'm not a porn star': 'Diddy' accuser says she asked to stop sex performances

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump planned to speak with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday, a White House official said.
articles.title: Trump expected to speak with Israel's Netanyahu, White House official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Colombian Senator Miguel Uribe, a potential presidential contender, is in critical condition and has shown little response to treatment after being shot in Bogota on Saturday, the hospital treating him said on Monday.
articles.title: Colombia's senator Uribe shows little response to treatment after shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran will soon hand a counter-proposal in nuclear talks to the United States via Oman, Iranian foreign ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Monday, in response to a U.S. offer that Tehran deems "unacceptable".
articles.title: Iran to present a counter-proposal to U.S. in nuclear talks, foreign ministry says

articles.author: Wa Lone
articles.description: Canada's Liberal government will pour extra billions into its armed forces and hit NATO's 2% military spending target this fiscal year, five years earlier than promised, Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Monday.
articles.title: Canada promises to boost defense spending, meet NATO target much earlier
